"A Mission Until Death"

Homunculi are combat dolls created through magical science.
In the endless war with the Empire, they have been mass-produced and discarded as non-human "expendables."

And then, as the end of the war begins to appear,
Only three combat homunculus remain in the Kingdom.

Iris.
Rita.
Alice.

As the Kingdom's last combat dolls, they have been given a final mission that does not assume survival.
There is only one condition for completing their mission:
"Keep fighting until you die."

There is no option to return alive from the start.
Self-destructing, shattering, slashing, burning.
No matter what the end may be, the only thing they are allowed is to "die with their role fulfilled."

One person is involved in this mission:
Hans, an intelligence officer working for the Empire.

He cannot take to the front lines, nor can he change their fate.
He can only watch from behind, embrace them,
and remember their inevitable farewell with a deep heartfelt sympathy.

What does Hans, a human, see in the dolls heading off to the battlefield, knowing they will die?
Weapons, comrades, or...

This is a heartwarming yet cruel tale of the final moments of women whose "mission is until death" and the humans who see them off.

[Volume]
734 pages

[Theme]
"Wasteful sex" at the end of their lives.
The story follows a man enjoying a final farewell sexual encounter with his dying sister.
The story is primarily consensual sex with an accepting death.
The women featured generally die, so please be aware of this when reading.
